FuncDef:
The igmp snooping query max-response-time command sets the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier.
The undo igmp snooping query max-response-time command restores the default setting. The igmp snooping query max-response-time command sets the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier. The undo igmp snooping query max-response-time command restores the default setting. By default, the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier is 10s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum time for a downstream host to respond to a querier.
The value ranges from 1 to 127 in the VSI view and 1 to 25 in other views, in seconds.
